intro: Gamochlamys, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Gamochlamys is often found in wetlands and along the edges of rivers in its native range. It is also known for its ability to thrive in moist, disturbed soils.
